description: Recorded since the 1560s. From the English apply +â€Ž -ance.

definitionGroups.group: An implement, an instrument or apparatus designed (or at least used) as a means to a specific end, especially:

entries.meaning: A non-manual apparatus or device, powered electrically or by another small motor, used in homes to perform domestic functions (household appliance) and/or in offices.
examples: Many house fires are caused by faulty appliances, such as refrigerators, washing machines and dryers.

entries.meaning: An attachment, a piece of equipment to adapt another tool or machine to a specific purpose.
(obsolete) A means of eliminating or counteracting something undesirable, especially an illness.
(obsolete, rare) Willing service, willingness to act as someone wishes.
